I'm a bit OCD when it comes to docking and alignment so I often place a single structural panel on both docking parts to indicate which side is "up" and to help better align the parts when docking.

![Y0vquws.png](http://i.imgur.com/Y0vquws.png)
Nah, I just make sure both craft are aligned on the same "plane" on the navball when docking. Nice solution, though.

> 
> No, because [Docking Port Alignment Indicator](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/43901-1-0-x-Docking-Port-Alignment-Indicator-%28Version-6-2-Updated-05-04-2015%29).

I never knew that existed. thanks!
Might I recommend using a single solar panel instead? It's less mass, possibly a little more visible, and serves a second purpose as, well, a solar panel.

Yoink!

(Well maybe not, but I am OCD about such things and have yet to come up with a solution for this one, so... ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) )
Uhhh... The last time docking gave me any sort of trouble was 0.19, so no. I do not do that.

> 
> No, because [Docking Port Alignment Indicator](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/43901-1-0-x-Docking-Port-Alignment-Indicator-%28Version-6-2-Updated-05-04-2015%29).

This is very useful for lining things up.

However, if one is opposed to mods, I must say that an antenna makes a useful indicator, as well:

![600px-Gemini_8_docking.jpg](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b5/Gemini_8_docking.jpg/600px-Gemini_8_docking.jpg)

> 
> Might I recommend using a single solar panel instead? It's less mass, possibly a little more visible, and serves a second purpose as, well, a solar panel.

Also never underestimate the power of the little green light on the DasValdez patented dorsal battery. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> No, because [Docking Port Alignment Indicator](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/43901-1-0-x-Docking-Port-Alignment-Indicator-%28Version-6-2-Updated-05-04-2015%29).

For alignment indication I typically put a spotlight on the active docking vessel. Align the vessels perpendicular to each other, aim the beam of light at the target port, hit H for a second and bang!

As for which side is up welll erm.... there's no up in space, right? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> This is very useful for lining things up.
> However, if one is opposed to mods, I must say that an antenna makes a useful indicator, as well

I'm not opposed to mods, so long as they are only visual aids such as RCS helper, Kerbal Engineer (and now Docking Helper added)

I just don't like using 3rd party parts or mods that fly the vessel for you, it kind of ruins the challenge that way.

I tend to put different colours of lights on the top and bottom of my craft for just this reason. Current favourite combo is blue/teal on top and purple on the bottom ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

![vzi4vTY.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/vzi4vTY.jpg)

(Full album for the curious: [http://imgur.com/a/pKDX8#0](http://imgur.com/a/pKDX8#0) )

I used to do this (although I'd use an antenna or a light), but my OCD is much better now. 

But, if it is absolutely mission critical to have PERFECT alignment, then another approach I sometimes use is a dual docking port setup.
This is why I use things with symmetry in a lot of directions. That way there are many "perfect alignments".

I like the lights suggestion, especially as I always try to have lights around my docking ports anyway.

I might have to go for dual docking ports instead, though, as the alignment is guaranteed (barring upside-down!) Unfortunately I am always riding the part count limit as it is... ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

modular rocket system has a part that is simple and non cheaty. Its just a docking port alignment plate you put behind them and it has a yellow and red light for indicating orientation, as well as green lights to show the docking port location easily. Mods aren't all bad ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
